intro: Neochilenia eriosyzoides var. roseiflora, commonly known as the rose-flowered neochilenia, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, rose-like flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically hairy and oval-shaped, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, shaded environments.
